greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = floor(n^(3/2)) - n*floor(n^(1/2)).
comment: a(n) is the coefficient of 1/n in the base n representation of sqrt(n); namely, the digit after the 'decimal' point. - _Jason Kimberley_, Feb 2012
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Jason Kimberley, Index of expansions of sqrt(d) in base b
xref: Cf. A000196 [the digit before the 'decimal' point in the base n representation of sqrt(n)], A000093.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 03 2002
